meanings.definition: To get off a horse or bicycle.
meanings.sent1: After the ride, I will dismount from the horse.
meanings.sent2: It is important to dismount the bicycle before crossing the road.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dismount a horse while it's moving would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She felt like a graceful dancer as she dismounted the horse.
meanings.sent5: The instructor showed us how to dismount safely from the bicycle.

meanings.definition: To remove from a mounting or support.
meanings.sent1: Please dismount the painting from the wall carefully.
meanings.sent2: The workers will dismount the old sign from the building.
meanings.sent3: He tried to dismount the heavy shelf but it got stuck!
meanings.sent4: The team had to dismount the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent5: It took hours to dismount the broken antenna from the roof.

meanings.definition: To descend from a high place.
meanings.sent1: The climber prepared to dismount the mountain after reaching the peak.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to dismount a tall tree safely.
meanings.sent3: The adventurer had to dismount the cliff using a rope.
meanings.sent4: She felt a rush of adrenaline as she dismounted the diving board.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to dismount the ladder quickly to rescue the kitten.
